title: Ring of cold resistance
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Ring_of_cold_resistance/ko "Ring of cold resistance/ko")

| =          |                                                               |   |   |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- | - | - |
| Name       | cold resistance                                               |   |   |
| Appearance | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |   |   |
| Base price | 150 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |   |   |
| Weight     | 3                                                             |   |   |

A **ring of cold resistance** is a type of [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [6.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
    - [6.2.1 Message](#Message)
  - [6.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [6.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, the ring of cold resistance can be sold in general [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and jewelers' shops.

## Description

While worn, the ring confers [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") - this prevents you from taking any [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") damage, though it can still affect your open inventory and shatter any [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") present.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec), extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a 99⁄100 chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage, making the ring much more useful in the long term.

## Strategy

Like some other resistance rings, the ring of cold resistance may be worth wearing early on to deal with obstacles such as an early [wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold"), or else as aid in obtaining the property intrinsically: for example, [blue jellies](/wiki/Blue_jellies "Blue jellies") are [sessile](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile") but cannot be attacked in melee without triggering their cold passives, and [winter wolves](/wiki/Winter_wolves "Winter wolves") and [their cubs](/wiki/Winter_wolf_cub "Winter wolf cub") can generate in the early game and cause severe damage with their breath. Their [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") and [tins](/wiki/Tin "Tin") along of such monsters also serve as decent sources of the intrinsic - additionally, once you have [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), most sources of cold damage are also unlikely to be a concern.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The ring protecting inventory from cold damage 99% of the time makes it much more useful in protecting potions from cold damage; [freezing spheres](/wiki/Freezing_sphere "Freezing sphere") also explode in a 3x3 range rather than directly at their target as of [commit 6b60618e](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/6b60618e0e662b35b8e9c31dc9c4baee5ae70932), making the ring and other extrinsic sources of cold resistance an ideal defense.

### Identification

- *Main article: [Price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification")*

The ring of cold resistance is 150[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm") like many other rings with resistance properties.

## History

In Hack 1.21, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), a ring of fire and cold resistance exists that confers both properties. The ring of cold resistance appears as its own item in Hack for PDP-11, and is also included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Messages

- The cold water faucet flashes brightly for a moment.

  You dropped a ring of cold resistance into a sink - this will prompt you to type-[name](/wiki/Name "Name") the ring.

## Variants

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), many intrinsics are gradual rather than binary, allowing the ring of cold resistance and similar items to remain useful for much longer.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the ring of cold resistance gives a message when worn, and like all extrinsic sources of cold resistance it also protects your inventory from cold damage. In addition, extrinsic sources of resistance properties are much more desirable, since many intrinsics in dNetHack time out depending on their source.

#### Message

- Your finger feels warm!

  You put on a ring of cold resistance.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), extrinsic sources of cold resistance and other elemental properties completely protect inventory from that element of damage for both the player and monsters.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), some intrinsics are gradual as in SporkHack rather than binary, including cold resistance, and reflection no longer completely protects you from the effects of elemental [rays](/wiki/Ray "Ray") - this makes the ring more useful in the short and long term. The ring of cold resistance is particularly desirable once you start encountering casters that use the [ice bolt](/wiki/Ice_bolt "Ice bolt") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").

The ring can be worthwhile to safely traverse the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm"), as it block cold damage from the level itself and the attacks of several monsters within - beware of [ice nymphs](/wiki/Ice_nymph "Ice nymph") stealing the ring off your finger if you do not have full intrinsic resistance or a backup extrinsic source!

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Ring of cold resistance

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

=
Name cold resistance
Appearance random
Base price 150 zm
Weight 3

A ring of cold resistance is a type of ring that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Identification
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SporkHack
    • 6.2 dNetHack
      • 6.2.1 Message
    • 6.3 xNetHack
    • 6.4 EvilHack

Generation

In addition to random generation, the ring of cold resistance can be sold in general shops and jewelers' shops.

Description

While worn, the ring confers cold resistance - this prevents you from taking any cold damage, though it can still affect your open inventory and shatter any potions present.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit 9942b65d, extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a 99⁄100 chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage, making the ring much more useful in the long term.

Strategy

Like some other resistance rings, the ring of cold resistance may be worth wearing early on to deal with obstacles such as an early wand of cold, or else as aid in obtaining the property intrinsically: for example, blue jellies are sessile but cannot be attacked in melee without triggering their cold passives, and winter wolves and their cubs can generate in the early game and cause severe damage with their breath. Their corpses and tins along of such monsters also serve as decent sources of the intrinsic - additionally, once you have reflection, most sources of cold damage are also unlikely to be a concern.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The ring protecting inventory from cold damage 99% of the time makes it much more useful in protecting potions from cold damage; freezing spheres also explode in a 3x3 range rather than directly at their target as of commit 6b60618e, making the ring and other extrinsic sources of cold resistance an ideal defense.

Identification

Main article: Price identification

The ring of cold resistance is 150zm like many other rings with resistance properties.

History

In Hack 1.21, which is based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, a ring of fire and cold resistance exists that confers both properties. The ring of cold resistance appears as its own item in Hack for PDP-11, and is also included in the initial item list for Hack 1.0.

Messages

The cold water faucet flashes brightly for a moment.
You dropped a ring of cold resistance into a sink - this will prompt you to type-name the ring.

Variants

SporkHack

In SporkHack, many intrinsics are gradual rather than binary, allowing the ring of cold resistance and similar items to remain useful for much longer.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, the ring of cold resistance gives a message when worn, and like all extrinsic sources of cold resistance it also protects your inventory from cold damage. In addition, extrinsic sources of resistance properties are much more desirable, since many intrinsics in dNetHack time out depending on their source.

Message

Your finger feels warm!
You put on a ring of cold resistance.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, extrinsic sources of cold resistance and other elemental properties completely protect inventory from that element of damage for both the player and monsters.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, some intrinsics are gradual as in SporkHack rather than binary, including cold resistance, and reflection no longer completely protects you from the effects of elemental rays - this makes the ring more useful in the short and long term. The ring of cold resistance is particularly desirable once you start encountering casters that use the ice bolt monster spell.

The ring can be worthwhile to safely traverse the Ice Queen's Realm, as it block cold damage from the level itself and the attacks of several monsters within - beware of ice nymphs stealing the ring off your finger if you do not have full intrinsic resistance or a backup extrinsic source!

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Ring_of_cold_resistance&oldid=162666"

A '''ring of cold resistance''' is a type of [[ring]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
In addition to random generation, the ring of cold resistance can be sold in general [[shop]]s and jewelers' shops.

==Description==
While worn, the ring confers [[cold resistance]] - this prevents you from taking any [[cold]] damage, though it can still affect your open inventory and shatter any [[potion]]s present.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Per {{commit|9942b65df78dd55a7806ec}}, extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a {{frac|99|100}} chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage, making the ring much more useful in the long term.}}

Like some other resistance rings, the ring of cold resistance may be worth wearing early on to deal with obstacles such as an early [[wand of cold]], or else as aid in obtaining the property intrinsically: for example, [[blue jellies]] are [[sessile]] but cannot be attacked in melee without triggering their cold passives, and [[winter wolves]] and [[Winter wolf cub|their cubs]] can generate in the early game and cause severe damage with their breath. Their [[corpse]]s and [[tin]]s along of such monsters also serve as decent sources of the intrinsic - additionally, once you have [[reflection]], most sources of cold damage are also unlikely to be a concern.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|The ring protecting inventory from cold damage 99% of the time makes it much more useful in protecting potions from cold damage; [[freezing sphere]]s also explode in a 3x3 range rather than directly at their target as of {{commit|6b60618e0e662b35b8e9c31dc9c4baee5ae70932}}, making the ring and other extrinsic sources of cold resistance an ideal defense.}}

The ring of cold resistance is 150[[zm]] like many other rings with resistance properties.

==History==
In Hack 1.21, which is based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], a ring of fire and cold resistance exists that confers both properties. The ring of cold resistance appears as its own item in Hack for PDP-11, and is also included in the initial item list for [[Hack 1.0]].

==Variants==

In [[xNetHack]], extrinsic sources of cold resistance and other elemental properties completely protect inventory from that element of damage for both the player and monsters.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], some intrinsics are gradual as in SporkHack rather than binary, including cold resistance, and reflection no longer completely protects you from the effects of elemental [[ray]]s - this makes the ring more useful in the short and long term. The ring of cold resistance is particularly desirable once you start encountering casters that use the [[ice bolt]] [[monster spell]].

The ring can be worthwhile to safely traverse the [[Ice Queen's Realm]], as it block cold damage from the level itself and the attacks of several monsters within - beware of [[ice nymph]]s stealing the ring off your finger if you do not have full intrinsic resistance or a backup extrinsic source!
